file_insights.changes_summary: Added error handling with user-facing toast notifications instead of silent failures
key_modifications: Imported useToast hook from ToastProvider component
Initialized showError function from useToast hook
Removed inline .catch(() => []) handlers from Promise.all API calls
Replaced console.error with showError toast notification
Centralized error handling in main try-catch block
file_insights.impact: Improved user experience by providing explicit error feedback instead of silently failing with empty data

patterns_discovered.description: Transition from silent error suppression (.catch(() => [])) to explicit user notification via toast
patterns_discovered.context: API calls now properly propagate errors to be caught in central catch block, triggering user-visible feedback
patterns_discovered.benefit: Better observability and user communication during data loading failures

patterns_discovered.description: Using ToastProvider's showError function for user-facing error messages instead of console logging
patterns_discovered.context: Consistent pattern for error notification across the application
patterns_discovered.benefit: Professional error UX with dismissible notifications rather than silent failures

patterns_discovered.description: Single catch block handling errors from multiple concurrent API calls
patterns_discovered.context: Promise.all with no individual error handlers, central catch block manages all failures
patterns_discovered.benefit: Simplified error management and uniform error response behavior

gotchas_discovered.description: Removed .catch(() => []) handlers that were silently returning empty arrays on API failures
gotchas_discovered.risk: If API fails, all related state will be undefined/empty rather than silently degraded
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: User receives explicit error notification via toast, allowing them to take action (refresh page)

gotchas_discovered.description: Promise.all will reject if any single promise rejects (after removing individual catch handlers)
gotchas_discovered.risk: Single failing API call will trigger error state for entire dashboard load
gotchas_discovered.note: This is actually desired behavior given the explicit user notification approach

approach_outcome.description: Successfully transformed error handling from silent failures to user-facing toast notifications
key_achievements: Removed defensive .catch() handlers allowing errors to surface
Maintained loading state management throughout error scenarios
approach_outcome.completion_status: Single attempt, completed successfully on first try

recommendations.suggestion: Consider implementing granular error handling for individual API calls to provide specific error messages
recommendations.rationale: Currently all API failures show generic message; users won't know which data source failed

recommendations.suggestion: Add retry mechanism for failed API calls instead of requiring full page refresh
recommendations.rationale: Error message says 'Please refresh the page' but automatic retry with user confirmation would be smoother

recommendations.suggestion: Log detailed error information (error.message, error.code, etc.) for monitoring while showing simplified message to user
recommendations.rationale: Removed console.error entirely; should maintain backend logging/monitoring of failures

recommendations.suggestion: Consider adding an 'error' state variable to preserve error context for potential recovery UI
recommendations.rationale: Currently only shows toast notification; storing error state would allow more sophisticated error recovery UI
